question: Is the list of best credits different from a transcript? Do I need to provide this?
answer: In the application form, there will be a separate form for you to fill in your list of best 140 ECTS credits. This is simply some help for us in order to calculate your aptitude score, where we only consider (a fraction of) your grades during your studies, i.e. the best ones. So, yes, this is different from your official transcript, which lists all your modules. You’re correct, AI in Society is indeed not listed as one of the programs asking for this document.

question: Can I include my Bachelor thesis as part of the proof for the completed practical project requirement for the M.Sc. AI in Society application, even if it won't be officially finalized by the application deadline?
answer: No, practical projects which will not be finalized by the application deadline cannot be accepted.

question: Can I include my 2 years of work experience in analyzing social media trends as part of the proof for the completed practical project requirement for the M.Sc. AI in Society application?
answer: Yes, you can include your work experience. You need to submit a work certificate from your company, which states what you have been working on and how long you have been working there. The duration of your work is relevant for the ECTS requirement – it is recalculated from hours to ECTS to make it comparable. For reference, 1 ECTS corresponds to 30 hours. Your work experience should cover 6x30 hours = 180 hours, which should suffice if you've been working there for over 2 years.

question: What kind of work experience is considered relevant for the M.Sc. AI in Society application?
answer: Interdisciplinary work experience is considered relevant. Pure computer science/programming work is not interdisciplinary. Work experience such as social media trend analysis, data analytics, generating insights, building a program to help solve societal problems, etc., is what is looked for when screening the applications.

question: Can I include my research paper on meat production analysis as part of the proof for the completed practical project requirement for the M.Sc. AI in Society application?
answer: Yes, if there was some practical/implementation aspect included (i.e. it was not a literature review kind of paper, but you actually ran some analysis yourself), it would make sense to include this.

question: Do the 18 ECTS required for the practical project need to come from a single project or can they be combined from different projects?
answer: The credits for the practical project do not need to come from a single module. They can be summed up from several modules.

question: Is it a problem for the application if my bachelor's thesis is not completed at the time of my application, so I will not have a grade or ECTS for it at that time?
answer: If you do not have the credits for the bachelor's thesis at the time of application, it is a problem insofar as you cannot provide them as proof for the practical project. It is also not possible to submit evidence for the 'practical project' requirement afterwards. These must be available at the end of the application.

question: Can I possibly prove the missing 6 ECTS through professional experience or other relevant (extracurricular) activities?
answer: For non-ECTS-based experiences (i.e., professional experience), we ask applicants to submit a work certificate or similar documentation. It must be clear to us: a) what the applicant has dealt with in terms of content, and b) the period in which the employment relationship existed (we roughly convert to hours. 1 ECTS corresponds to approx. 30h. Your missing 2 ECTS should be easily covered).

question: Is it possible to credit my professional experience for the 'practical project' requirement?
answer: You should indicate your work-student activity in the 'Practical Project' section when applying. For non-ECTS-based experiences (i.e., professional experience), we ask applicants to submit a work certificate or similar documentation. It must be clear to us: a) what the applicant has dealt with in terms of content, and b) the period in which the employment relationship existed (we roughly convert to hours. 1 ECTS corresponds to approx. 30h. Your missing 2 ECTS should be easily covered).

question: In the requirements for the MSc. AI in Society, it is mentioned that applicants should have completed a practical project worth at least 18 credits during their bachelor’s studies. Would I still be eligible for this program if the sum of my completed modules would meet the required 18 credit points?
answer: Yes, you are free to submit multiple practical modules which in sum make up 18 ECTS. The wording is a bit confusing, leading people to think that we require one single project worth 18 credits.

question: What should I write as a declaration of authorship in my motivation letter?
answer: You can write the following: “I hereby certify that this letter is solely my own work, developed without assistance, and any external sources are marked as such.”

question: Where can I upload my letter of recommendation to document my previous professional experience?
answer: Please attach it in the field for the proof of practical project.

question: Do you also need proof of my self-employment, or are my examinations in the motivation letter and CV enough?
answer: Unfortunately, we cannot accept self-employment as evidence of practical experience, since no formal, objective, and independent certificate of employment can be issued. Please list evidence such as university modules, internships, or (“regular”) employment.

question: Why only the test score and GPA are considered for credit, while other application processes, such as Politics & Technology, MMT etc., credit the motivation letter and core modules from the previous academic background?
answer: Different study programs have different requirements for their prospective students. In our case, for example, we put a high weight on the applicant’s ability to complete practical projects as well as bring along background knowledge in certain fields, which we are testing in the aptitude test. Other study programs might have different requirements.

question: Can I apply for the study program, get an offer for a place, and accept it only a year later?
answer: Yes, you can apply for the study program, get an offer for a place, and accept it only a year later. In this case, you’d do the following: refuse the offer. Re-apply to the program a year later (please then upload the basic documents again, like an up-to-date CV, since a year will have passed). Afterwards, you won’t have to go through the aptitude assessment process anymore, but will go straight to admission.

question: Can I submit my proof over maths/statistics modules from my Master’s?
answer: You can submit your proof over maths/statistics modules from your Master’s, as well. In this case, please also attach the Transcript of Records from your Master’s, so we can verify.

question: Can I submit an offer letter as proof of employment?
answer: It would be better if you could submit the certificates of employment to us, since an offer letter doesn’t indicate that you actually took the offer.

question: What is the 'list of best credits' and do I need to provide it for the AI in Society program?
answer: The 'list of best credits' is a separate form for you to fill in your list of best 140 ECTS credits. This is simply some help for us in order to calculate your aptitude score, where we only consider (a fraction of) your grades during your studies, i.e. the best ones. This is different from your official transcript, which lists all your modules. AI in Society is indeed not listed as one of the programs asking for this document.

question: What is the duration and compensation for participating in the VR study?

question: What are the costs for publishing a study programme in the 'International Programmes in Germany 2024/25' database?

question: What is the concern about credit to ECTS conversion of the transcript?
answer: The concern is about the conversion rate from the applicant's credit to ECTS. The applicant is from a five-year Bachelor of Architecture program, which according to 30 ECTS per semester, should include 300 ECTS in total. However, the credits needed to graduate from this program is 204 credits in five years, leading to a conversion rate of about 1.5.

question: What is the proof of passing module in mathematics?
answer: The applicant has 4 credits in a mathematics course, which is equal to 6 ECTS. This has already surpassed the requirement.

question: What is the request regarding the five-year program for architecture students?
answer: The applicant requests that the five-year program for architecture students be considered when reviewing their application materials.

question: Is it possible to submit an application for the AI in Society master’s program before completing the APS process and obtaining the VPD certificate, and provide these documents at a later stage?
answer: No, incomplete applications cannot be accepted, and applicants cannot submit certain documents after the deadline (May 31) has passed.

question: Does the AI in Society master's program at TUM focus on developing AI or integrating this technology into multiple projects?
answer: The AI in Society master's program at TUM does provide opportunities to code, such as the modules “Intro to Programming & [REDACTED]”, “Intro to [REDACTED]”, “[REDACTED]”, “[REDACTED]”. However, the course is not intended to make you an AI engineer. If you would like to focus on the technical side, it is recommended to apply to the Master’s in [REDACTED] or similar at TUM.

question: Is the AI in Society master's program at TUM suited for someone who comes from a [REDACTED] bachelor's degree with a Business but also some technical understanding?
answer: The course is highly interdisciplinary and a background in business is a plus. If you have some technical understanding, it will already be a great help for you. It should not be a problem.

question: Will it be possible for me to work part-time in a company while I study the AI in Society master's program at TUM?
answer: It is possible to work part-time, but the study load (especially in the first 1-2 semesters) is not low. You will have to try and see if it works out for you.

question: How does the timetable look for the AI in Society master's program at TUM? Is it only classes in the morning or only classes in the evening, or a mix?
answer: The scheduling is up to the professors and many courses are not set up yet, since the degree program is under active construction at the moment. It cannot be confirmed whether the courses will be rather in the morning or rather in the evening.

question: Would a practical project on 'data-driven marketing strategy with a customer-centred approach' be valid for the application to the dual study programme?
answer: Your topic sounds very suitable - this should work out well.

question: Is there any further information on how the admission test is structured and what questions can be expected?

question: If my degree program was taught in English, do I need to provide an IELTS test or similar?
answer: If your degree program was taught in English, you do not need to provide us an IELTS test or similar. Please instead get a confirmation about the language of instruction from your university.

question: Where can I find more information about the application process for the M.Sc. AI in Society program at TUM?

question: Where can I find more information about scholarships at TUM?
answer: Regarding scholarships, I would kindly redirect you to TUM’s scholarship office. For more information and their contact, please see here: https://www.tum.de/en/studies/fees-and-financial-aid/scholarships

question: Can I still apply for the Master in AI in Society program at TUM if I lack the requirement of a thesis or project with credits from my Bachelor degree?
answer: You can prove your practical expertise through work experience as well, it doesn’t necessarily have to be a university course. You might have, for example, worked at a company during your studies, where you were working on projects relevant to our study field. This experience also counts, but you will need to submit suitable proof for this (e.g. in the form of a certificate of employment). For reference, 18 ECTS credits correspond to a workload of 540 hours. If you submit such proof of practical experience (which was not part of your degree program), it needs to indicate how much time you spent on it, and have it correspond to our 18 ECTS requirement. It also has to be clear to us what exactly you were working on.

question: Am I eligible to apply to the Master in AI in Society program at TUM with a bachelor GPA of 2.4?
answer: Eligibility is calculated based on the grades of your best modules (there will be a form for you to fill inside the application process). It is not definitively stated whether a GPA of 2.4 will pass.

question: Will my age be an issue for application to the Master in AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: Your age is definitely not a problem in any way.

question: Can I apply for the M.Sc. AI in Society program at TUM if I don't have a bachelor's thesis or a project with credits, but have extensive work experience?
answer: Yes, you can prove your practical expertise through work experience. This might include working on projects relevant to the study field during your employment. However, you will need to submit suitable proof for this, such as a certificate of employment. The proof of practical experience needs to indicate how much time you spent on it, and it should correspond to the 18 ECTS requirement of the program. It also has to be clear what exactly you were working on.

question: Can you provide further information about the application process for the M.Sc. AI in Society program?

question: Why was the request for 'Preliminary review documentation (VPD) or Confirmation that the application for a VPD by uni-assist has been submitted in due form and time' not there before?

question: What exactly is wrong with my CV?

question: When doing the application for AI & Society, there is no place to insert the VPD. So, can I assume that I don't have to upload the VPD?
answer: If you were not asked for a VPD anywhere, it should be fine.

question: How long more or less does it take to get an answer in the application?
answer: This might happen over the next 2-3 weeks.

question: What should I do about the VPD requirement in my application?
answer: You have indicated that you have applied for the VPD in full. Your proof of this has been received and provisionally OK. The document is now only set to 'not OK' so that you can upload the final VPD here. Uni-assist will email you the final VPD once it is complete. Depending on how old your previous VPD is, you can submit it here again (we accept VPDs that are up to 3 years old). Otherwise, you must submit a new VPD.

question: What is the deadline for the application process?
answer: The deadline for the application process is May 31st.

question: Can changes be made to the application after it has been completed?
answer: No, once the application has been completed, it cannot be changed, even within the exclusion period.

question: Can the certificate and the Bachelor's degree be submitted later?

question: Can examination achievements be submitted after the exclusion period?
answer: No, examination achievements cannot be submitted after the exclusion period.

question: Can applicants submit proof of practical experience in the form of their Bachelor's thesis if it is not completed at the time of application?
answer: No, it is not intended that examination achievements from the Bachelor's degree, which are only completed after the application deadline, can be submitted later.

question: What is the application deadline for the M.Sc. AI in Society program?

question: What documents are required for the application to the M.Sc. AI in Society program?

question: Can applicants submit documents after the application deadline for the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: No, applicants cannot submit any documents after the deadline has passed.

question: Can multiple practical projects be submitted as part of the application to the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: Yes, it doesn’t need to be one single project: you can submit several ones, which will then be summed up.

question: Can practical experience outside of the degree program be considered for the M.Sc. AI in Society program application?

question: Why do different study programs handle their admission process differently?
answer: Different study programs have different requirements for their prospective students. For example, some programs put a high weight on the applicant’s ability to complete practical projects and bring along background knowledge in certain fields, which are tested in the aptitude test.

question: What is the importance of the aptitude test in the admission process for the Master's program 'AI in Society'?
answer: The aptitude test is used to assess an applicant's ability to complete practical projects and their background knowledge in certain fields.

question: Does the practical project need to be recognized with credits, i.e. does it have to be part of my university course?
answer: Technically, we can count practical projects that were not part of a university module. However, you would then need to provide us with an official documentation that those practical projects in total spanned at least 540 hours for completion (540h correspond to 18 ECTS).

question: Would individual projects or volunteer experience be able to also contribute to the requirement?
answer: Individual projects can contribute to the requirement if you can provide official documentation that those practical projects in total spanned at least 540 hours for completion (540h correspond to 18 ECTS).

question: Can the project be part of a course or does it have to stand individually?
answer: The project can be part of a course. You don’t need to submit your project reports to prove your completion of the module. Instead, you submit your Transcript of Records as part of the application procedure (this module should then of course be listed in this Transcript), as well as fill out a form which states the name of the project module, as well as the module/project description.

question: How can I prove the projects that I did in the courses?
answer: You don’t need to submit your project reports to prove your completion of the module. Instead, you submit your Transcript of Records as part of the application procedure (this module should then of course be listed in this Transcript), as well as fill out a form which states the name of the project module, as well as the module/project description.

question: Do the 18 ECTS from a practical project, required for the Master's program AI in Society, have to come from a single project or can they be composed of two different projects?
answer: The credits for the practical project do not have to come from a single module. They can be summed up from several modules, so that is not a problem.

question: Is it a problem for the application if my bachelor's thesis is not yet completed at the time of my application, so I will not have a grade or ECTS for it yet?
answer: If you do not have the credits for the bachelor's thesis at the time of application, it is a problem insofar as you cannot use these as proof for the practical project. It is also not possible to submit evidence for the 'Practical Project' requirement afterwards. These must be available at the end of the application -- I ask for your understanding.

question: Can I make up for the missing 6 ECTS through professional experience or other relevant (extracurricular) activities?
answer: You may be able to prove the missing 6 ECTS through professional experience or other relevant (extracurricular) activities.

question: Do I need to submit an English proficiency certificate for the M.Sc. AI in Society program if my degree’s language of instruction was English?
answer: If your degree’s language of instruction was English, you do not have to submit additional proof of English proficiency.

question: Can I be exempted from submitting an English proficiency certificate for the M.Sc. AI in Society program if I studied in the UK for the last year of my double degree bachelor program and obtained 60 ECTS including the bachelor's thesis?
answer: If your degree’s language of instruction was English, you do not have to submit additional proof of English proficiency.

question: What should an applicant with pre-diploma qualifications do when having difficulties applying to the AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: The applicant should ask their universities if they can issue the relevant ECTS or, if not possible, the respective SWS for their degree. If these documents can be obtained, they should be uploaded or sent to the admissions team.

question: How should an applicant with a diploma degree proceed when applying to the AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: The applicant should upload the documents they have or can obtain. If they can submit a grade transcript or semester study plans that further highlight the thematic content of the studies, that would be helpful.

question: How does the aptitude committee assess practical experience for the AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: The aptitude committee decides if an applicant has suitable/sufficient practical experience. Applicants should submit evidence of their work, such as employment references.

question: What should be done if an applicant with a diploma degree cannot provide ECTS credits?
answer: The applicant should not be formally rejected because they have a diploma degree and therefore cannot provide ECTS credits. The diploma engineer is a highly renowned degree comparable to a master's degree. The applicant should be allowed into the aptitude process just like applicants with a bachelor's degree if the submitted documents show that they have the necessary competencies.

question: How should grades from a diploma degree be considered in the application process for the AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: In case of doubt, the overall average grade should be used for the points for the grade (Annex 2, No. 5.1.1 a) Sentence 10).

question: Will the Aptitude test and interview be online?
answer: It is not yet decided if an online version of the aptitude test will be offered, but it is currently planned. The interview can be conducted online if there is no way of conducting it in person.

question: Do you have the dates more or less when it will happen?
answer: Exact dates are not available, but it is expected to happen mid-June. The exact date will be communicated at least one week in advance.

question: What should I do if the document for listing undergraduate modules does not provide enough space for all my modules?
answer: You should download the document twice and use the extra rows from the second copy. Then upload both forms. It would be great if you could fuse the two documents into one PDF before uploading.

question: Is it needed to ask for the VPD when I have already a Master's degree from TUM?
answer: If you were not asked for a VPD anywhere, it should be fine.

question: When doing the application for AI & Society, there is no place to insert the VPD. So, can I assume that I don't have to upload the VPD?
answer: If you were not asked for a VPD anywhere, it should be fine.

question: How long more or less does it take to get an answer in the application?
answer: Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. If something is missing in your application, you will be contacted again. If everything is fine, you will also get informed. This might happen over the next 2-3 weeks.

question: What is the application procedure for the M.Sc. “AI in Society” at TUM?
answer: All relevant information for the application procedure can be found on the following websites: https://www.tum.de/en/studies/degree-programs/detail/ai-in-society and https://www.sot.tum.de/sot/studium/ai-in-society/

question: Do I need to go through the college for one year to have access to the course or do I have access directly to it from my current situation?
answer: You need to apply with a Bachelor’s degree. If during the application period (until May 31st) you will not have finished your bachelor’s degree yet, 140 ECTS credits of your Bachelor’s studies are sufficient, assuming that you will finish your Bachelor’s degree still before the start of the Master’s.

question: Do I fulfill the requirement for the practical project for the M.Sc. AI in Society at TUM if I sum all of the credits for which I had a project and it is over 18 ECTS?
answer: You should submit the entire modules as proof for the practical project requirement. Your case might become a question for the admission committee to decide upon. For now, count the entire modules containing those practical projects inside of them.

question: Can a bachelor's thesis in the field of data analysis, which is worth 12 ECTS, be recognized as equivalent to the 'practical project' requirement of at least 18 credits for the AI in Society master's program?
answer: The bachelor's thesis can be counted towards the practical project requirement, but as it only covers 12 ECTS, it is not entirely sufficient. Additional practical-oriented modules from the bachelor's program or relevant experience outside of studies, if properly documented, can be used to cover the remaining 6 ECTS. For example, if the experience is from a relevant part-time student job, an employment certificate would be a good proof. To cover the missing 6 ECTS, a proof that this experience has covered at least 6x30h = 180h is required, along with a description of this project.

question: Can you tell where I can find the list of the admission requirements for the AI and society master?
answer: The following links should work and contain all relevant information: https://www.sot.tum.de/sot/studium/ai-in-society/, https://www.sot.tum.de/sot/studium/ai-in-society/application/, https://www.tum.de/en/studies/degree-programs/detail/ai-in-society.

question: Could you send me a link of the website that doesn’t work for you?
answer: The website link that doesn’t work is https://www.sot.tum.de/en/sot/404-notfound-sot-en/.

question: Where can I find the list of the admission requirements for the AI and Society master's program at TUM?
answer: The admission requirements for the AI and Society master's program at TUM can be found at the following links: https://www.sot.tum.de/sot/studium/ai-in-society/, https://www.sot.tum.de/sot/studium/ai-in-society/application/, https://www.tum.de/en/studies/degree-programs/detail/ai-in-society.

question: What happens when the website page showing the additional admission requirements doesn't work?
answer: If the website page showing the additional admission requirements doesn't work, you can reach out for assistance and you will be provided with working links that contain all relevant information.

question: Could you send me a link of the website that doesn’t work for you? Does it not load?
answer: Here is the website link that doesn’t work. It just show and error404. https://www.sot.tum.de/en/sot/404-notfound-sot-en/

question: What is the minimum mathematics/statistics background required for the program?
answer: The examination regulation requires 5 ECTS of mathematics and/or statistics obtained as part of previous study programs.

question: Can the mathematics/statistics requirement be fulfilled through participation in online courses?
answer: No, the requirement cannot be made up for through participation in online courses.

question: Do the attached transcripts fulfil the minimum requirements of mathematics/statistics background?
answer: No, the attached transcripts do not fulfil the minimum requirements of mathematics/statistics background.

question: Is it possible to use multiple practical projects (each 4-8 ECTS) as valid proof if they together are ≥ 18 ECTS?
answer: Yes, it does not have to be a single project over 18 ECTS, it can also be accumulated from several projects.

question: How should applicants with pre-diploma qualifications proceed when applying to the AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: Applicants should ask their universities if they can issue the relevant ECTS or, if not possible, the respective SWS for their degree. If these documents can be obtained, they should be uploaded or sent to the admissions team.

question: How does the aptitude committee assess practical experience for the AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: The aptitude committee decides if an applicant has suitable/sufficient practical experience. Applicants should submit evidence of their work, such as employment references.

question: Does the practical project need to be recognized with credits, i.e. does it have to be part of my university course?
answer: Technically, practical projects that were not part of a university module can be counted.

question: Would individual projects or volunteer experience be able to also contribute to the requirement?
answer: Individual projects can contribute to the requirement, but they need to be officially documented, showing that they spanned at least 540 hours for completion (540h correspond to 18 ECTS).

question: Can the project be part of a course or does it have to stand individually?
answer: The email does not provide a clear answer to this question.

question: If from my university, I do not officially have 18 credits for a practical project in social science, is there a way to make up for this requirement?
answer: Yes, by providing official documentation of practical projects that in total spanned at least 540 hours for completion.

question: What should I do if my foreign university's courses are not provided in the form of modules and I have more courses than the provided rows in the 'List of best 140 Credits' form for the 'AI in Society' master program application?
answer: You can download the respective form two times to fill in all your courses, then mark which is the first, and which is the second (e.g. insert “1” and “2” somewhere on the PDF), and upload both of them. You may need to merge these two PDFs back into one.

question: When is the application deadline for the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: Applications are open until May 31st.

question: When will the review of application documents take place for the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: The review of application documents will take place after the application deadline of May 31st.

question: When will applicants be invited to the written aptitude test for the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: Applicants will be invited to the written aptitude test after the review of their application documents, which will be after May 31st.

question: What format should the documentation of the completed project take for the M.Sc. AI in Society application?
answer: To prove your completion of a practical project, you will find a form to fill out inside the application process. There you will be asked to enter the module title and module description. These should be translated into English and inserted in the form.

question: Is the original thesis document, accompanied by an English introduction summarizing it, sufficient as proof of the project's completion for the M.Sc. AI in Society application?
answer: You do not need to submit your thesis for the application. For proof, you will have to provide your Transcript of Records when you’re applying. This module should also be listed there.

question: What format should the documentation of the completed project take?
answer: To prove your completion of a practical project, you will find a form to fill out inside the application process. There you will be asked to enter the module title and module description. Please translate these into English and insert in the form.

question: Since my thesis was not written in English, would the original thesis document, accompanied by an English introduction summarizing it, suffice as proof of the project's completion?
answer: For proof, you will also have to provide your Transcript of Records when you’re applying. This module should also be listed there. It would be best if you could submit a Transcript of Records issued by your university in English. If your university does not provide this document in English automatically, please ask them to issue an [REDACTED] for you. You do not need to submit your thesis for the application.

question: Is it possible to get a waiver for the requirement to provide an IELTS or TOEFL certificate if my Master's program was conducted entirely in English?
answer: If your language of instruction was English, this is already sufficient.

question: If I am eligible for a waiver of the English proficiency certificate, would it be necessary for my university to provide a document verifying that English was the language of instruction during my Master's studies?
answer: If you wish to submit a confirmation of your language of instruction as proof of your English language proficiency, the confirmation has to be issued by an administrative unit of the university on official university paper and has to bear a seal and an original signature.

question: Does the practical project for the AI for society program need to be recognized with credits, i.e. does it have to be part of my university course?
answer: The recognition of qualifications achieved outside of a university is possible. If the content condition of engineering/natural science knowledge + political-social knowledge + practical application is fulfilled and a volume of at least 18 credits = 540 hours can be proven, it could be recognized as a practical project.

question: Would individual projects or volunteer experience be able to also contribute to the requirement for the AI for society program?
answer: If the content condition of engineering/natural science knowledge + political-social knowledge + practical application is fulfilled and a volume of at least 18 credits = 540 hours can be proven, individual projects or volunteer experience could be recognized as a practical project.

question: If from my university, I do not officially 18 credits for a practical project in social science, is there a way to make up for this requirement for the AI for society program?
answer: If the content condition of engineering/natural science knowledge + political-social knowledge + practical application is fulfilled and a volume of at least 18 credits = 540 hours can be proven, it could be recognized as a practical project.

question: What kind of proof is needed to verify the hours spent on a practical project for the AI for society program?
answer: A credible documentation of practical experience is important. Verifiable documents that confirm content and scope should be able to be presented.

question: How can I apply for a Master’s program at TUM?
answer: To be admitted to any study program, you need to apply through TUM’s official application website. Professors cannot admit you themselves. More information can be found at: https://www.tum.de/en/studies/application/application-info-portal/online-application

question: Who will send the link to the application portal for the MSc. AI in Society program?
answer: Ms. [REDACTED] will send a link to the application portal.

question: Are there any limitations on who can apply for the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: There are no limitations on who can apply, per se. It does not matter which Bachelor’s program you have studied specifically. It only matters that you fulfil the requirements.

question: What are the requirements for applying to the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: The requirements include having passed at least 5 ECTS from the fields of mathematics / statistics, as well as having completed a practical project worth at least 18 ECTS.

question: What does the requirement of 'List of [REDACTED]' mean for the M.Sc. AI in Society program application?
answer: The 'List of [REDACTED]' requirement asks you to submit your best 140 ECTS credits, meaning, listing the modules where you got the best grades, overall worth 140 credits. The information about 90 credits is referring to something different and is not relevant for this Master’s.

question: What are the requirements for the practical project for the MSc. AI in Society application?
answer: If you have completed at least 18 ECTS (your bachelor's thesis can also be counted) in a/multiple practical project(s), which involve a) some sort of technical tools and b) some societal aspect, we highly encourage you to apply. If you have the 18 ECTS, but aren't quite sure if the topics of your projects fit perfectly, please apply regardless.

question: Is it valid to upload the proof of classes that I have taken that relate to the field of AI and society for the 'Proof of successful participation in a practical project relevant to the course of study within at least 18 credits including module description' requirement?
answer: The practical project should be one you have completed as part of your studies and must be worth at least 18 ECTS credits. If you additionally participated in a relevant project outside of your studies, you can incorporate it in an optional motivational letter.

question: Can I apply to this master with some documents that I already have from October of last year from my Bachelors degree in Colombia?
answer: If your 86% correspond to at least 140 ECTS credits, then this is sufficient. However, your completed modules also need to include at least 5 ECTS from the fields of mathematics or statistics.

question: Can I use a VPD from uni-assist from October last year for the application?
answer: If you still have a valid VPD, there is no need to get a new one. Please submit the one you already have.

question: If I don't have the project that you are inquiring about, is it worthy giving it a try to the application?
answer: If you have completed projects during your studies that are roughly in the field we describe (even if not matching perfectly), we highly encourage you to apply.

question: As an applicant for the AI in Society program who has just registered for FAU's summer semester master's program, do I need to go through the transfer process or can I directly use my Bachelor degree to apply?
answer: You can directly apply with your bachelor’s degree. You do not need to go through any additional transfer processes. However, if you complete relevant courses during your semester in FAU’s program, feel free to list them as well. You will need to deregister from your old university.

question: Do I need to add FAU's study experience to my resume when applying for the AI in Society program?
answer: If you complete relevant courses during your semester in FAU’s program, feel free to list them as well.

question: What is required to submit when applying for the AI in Society program?
answer: Submitting your bachelor’s transcript of records is mandatory, and the best 140 ECTS credits based on your bachelor’s degree will be counted.

question: Can my bachelor's and master's theses be considered as practical projects for the AI in Society program at TUM?
answer: You should submit any relevant module that you have completed during your previous studies. Any practical project which you have received credits for will be counted if it is relevant content-wise.

question: While looking at the admission requirements for the AI in Society program, it says a practical project of at least 18 ECTS is required. Since the bachelor program of TUM Informatik only offers thesis of 15 credits, does this mean I will not be qualified, even if the content of the thesis project is qualified for the application?
answer: If your thesis spans 15 ECTS and fits well into the field of technology applied to social sciences, then we highly encourage you to apply anyways! You may have taken another practical course during your bachelor’s studies that would provide the missing 3 ECTS – please list them all in the application process (even if they do not fit the required theme perfectly).

question: What should I do if the application process requires more information?
answer: There will be separate forms to fill in this information in a more organized manner soon. Check back inside the application platform in around a week and apply with the provided forms.

question: What is the format of the list of the best 140 ECTS along with the proof of the practical project worth at least 18 ECTS credits completed during bachelor’s studies that I need to submit on my online application for the Master of Science - AI in Society program?
answer: The respective forms for the list of the best 140 ECTS and the proof of the practical project worth at least 18 ECTS credits will be provided inside the application platform in about a week.

question: How can I prove my project has 18 ECTS for the AI in Society MSc. program application?
answer: A form is being prepared that will allow you to enter information about your practical project in an organized manner. This form will also explain how to calculate whether your project's credits correspond to at least 18 ECTS credits. You will need to provide the module description of this project, which you may need to obtain from the instructor of the module.

question: Can projects that do not incorporate a social science perspective be counted towards the practical project requirement for the AI in Society MSc. program?
answer: Projects that do not incorporate some sort of social science perspective cannot be counted towards the practical project requirement. However, you are welcome to include them in the optional motivational letter.

question: What should I do if there is no document regarding the content of the project in my university's system?
answer: You may need to reach out to the instructor of the module and ask for an official module description.

question: Is it valid to upload the proof of classes that I have taken that relate to the field of AI and society for the 'Proof of successful participation in a practical project relevant to the course of study within at least 18 credits including module description' requirement?
answer: The practical project should be a project you have completed as part of your studies, since it must be worth at least 18 ECTS credits. If you additionally participated in a relevant project outside of your studies, you are welcome to incorporate it in an optional motivational letter.

question: Can I apply to the M.Sc. AI in Society program with some documents that I already have from October of last year from my Bachelors degree in Colombia?
answer: If your 86% correspond to at least 140 ECTS credits, then this is sufficient. However, your completed modules also need to include at least 5 ECTS from the fields of mathematics or statistics.

question: Can I use a VPD from uni-assist from October last year for my application to the M.Sc. AI in Society program?
answer: If you still have a valid VPD, there is no need to get a new one. Please submit the one you already have.

question: Would my current MMT degree provide any exemptions or benefits during the application process to MSc AI in Society?
answer: An additional Master’s degree (e.g. in MMT) does not provide particular benefits for you regarding the application process, except for the (optional) motivational letter you can hand in. If you can incorporate your previous studies into a motivation of why you are particularly interested in the study program, please feel free to do so.

question: Can I request for recognition of modules from the MMT program in the AIS program?
answer: Depending on your modules from the MMT program, you may hand in a request for recognition of those modules in case they are either the same lectures also taught in AIS, or equivalent content-wise. For this you have time until up to one year after admission to the AIS program.

question: Would I still be required to pay the standard application fee, or are there any fee waivers or reductions available for current international students?
answer: There are no particular exceptions for fees. For general information about fees for international students, refer to the TUM website.

question: Would my current MMT degree provide any exemptions or benefits during the application process to MSc AI in Society?
answer: It depends on whether there were modules completed in the MMT program that also appear in the AIS study plan. Including this information in the motivation letter might also be beneficial for the application process.
